Name: Periodista Daiquiri
Ingredients: 50 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
7.5 ml De Kuyper Apricot Brandy liqueur
5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
10 ml Chilled water omit if using wet ice
2 drop Saline solution 4:1 (20g sea salt to 80g water)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of lime zest twist expressed and discarded. Adorn with skewered lime wedge and Luxardo Maraschino Cherry .
Review: An orange and apricot Daiquiri . Like most Daiquiris, the Periodista benefits from a little additional dilution, hence the chilled water in my recipe.
History: Periodista (Spanish for 'journalist') originated in Havana, Cuba, where it is said to have been one of Ernest Hemingway's tipples at El Floridita. In keeping with the Cuban origin, the earliest known recipe appears in the 1948 El Arte de Cantinera , a bartenders' manual from the Club de Cantineros de la Republica de Cuba in Havana.
Nutrition: One serving of Periodista Daiquiri contains 163 calories
